exercises.qti:
question_type essay_question

V5.

Consider the statement

Given vector and , there exist non-zero scalars and such that .

Does the diagram correctly depict this statement?

<div class="exercise-statement"> <p> <strong>V5.</strong> </p> <p>Consider the statement </p> <p> Given vector <img style="border:1px #ddd solid;padding:5px;border-radius:5px;" src="https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.latex?%5Cvec%7Bu%7D" alt="\vec{u}" title="\vec{u}" data-latex="\vec{u}"> and <img style="border:1px #ddd solid;padding:5px;border-radius:5px;" src="https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.latex?%5Cvec%7Bv%7D" alt="\vec{v}" title="\vec{v}" data-latex="\vec{v}">, there exist non-zero scalars <img style="border:1px #ddd solid;padding:5px;border-radius:5px;" src="https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.latex?a_1" alt="a_1" title="a_1" data-latex="a_1"> and <img style="border:1px #ddd solid;padding:5px;border-radius:5px;" src="https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.latex?a_2" alt="a_2" title="a_2" data-latex="a_2"> such that <img style="border:1px #ddd solid;padding:5px;border-radius:5px;" src="https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.latex?a_1%5Cvec%7Bu%7D%20+%20a_2%5Cvec%7Bv%7D%20=%20%5Cvec%7B0%7D" alt="a_1\vec{u} + a_2\vec{v} = \vec{0}" title="a_1\vec{u} + a_2\vec{v} = \vec{0}" data-latex="a_1\vec{u} + a_2\vec{v} = \vec{0}">.</p> Does the diagram correctly depict this statement? </div>

Partial Answer:

The vectors should be colinear in the diagram.

 <div class="exercise-answer"> <h4>Partial Answer:</h4> <p>The vectors should be colinear in the diagram.</p> </div>
exercises.pretext:
Consider the statement Given vector \vec{u} and \vec{v}, there exist non-zero scalars a_1 and a_2 such that a_1\vec{u} + a_2\vec{v} = \vec{0}. Does the diagram correctly depict this statement?

The vectors should be colinear in the diagram.
exercises.html:
Consider the statement

Given vector \(\vec{u}\) and \(\vec{v}\), there exist non-zero scalars \(a_1\) and \(a_2\) such that \(a_1\vec{u} + a_2\vec{v} = \vec{0}\).

Does the diagram correctly depict this statement?

Answer:

The vectors should be colinear in the diagram.

The vectors should not be colinear in the diagram.

exercises.pretext:
Consider the statement Given vector \vec{u} and \vec{v}, any combination of scalars a_1 and a_2 will maintain a_1\vec{u} + a_2\vec{v} \neq \vec{0}. Does the diagram correctly depict this statement?

The vectors should not be colinear in the diagram.
exercises.html:
Consider the statement

Given vector \(\vec{u}\) and \(\vec{v}\), any combination of scalars \(a_1\) and \(a_2\) will maintain \(a_1\vec{u} + a_2\vec{v} \neq \vec{0}\).

Does the diagram correctly depict this statement?

Answer:

The vectors should not be colinear in the diagram.
